questions.question:
1. Choose the correct present simple forms to complete the following sentence
People ___________ (speak) Spanish here, they speak French
Which sentence correctly uses the comparative form of the adjective "fast"?
options: The car moves fastly down the highway.
Tom runs more fast than his brother.
This train is faster than the previous one.
She types very fast than anyone I know.

questions.question:

"There is _________ water in the glass than in the bottle."
Which sentence correctly uses the future continuous tense?
options: Tomorrow, I am reading a book.
By next week, they will drive to the beach.
At 9 PM tonight, she is cooking dinner.
At noon tomorrow, he will be playing basketball.

questions.question:
Convert the following direct speech into reported speech:

Direct Speech: "I will visit my grandparents next weekend," said Tom.
options: Tom said that he visited his grandparents the following weekend.
Tom said that he would visit his grandparents the following weekend.
Tom said that he is visiting his grandparents next weekend.
Tom said that he visits his grandparents next weekend.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct time clause usage:
options: We will go to the park after it is raining.
She will call you before she is finishing work.
They arrived at the party after they will eat dinner.
He will start studying once he will finish his dinner.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct usage of indirect questions:
options: She asked, "What time does the movie start?"
He wondered if they were going to the party.
"Can you tell me where is the nearest ATM?" she inquired.
She asked if we was doing it correctly

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a modal verb to express possibility:
options: She must go to the beach tomorrow.
They can went to the concert last night.
It could will rain later this evening.
He may arrive late due to traffic.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a modal verb to express obligation:
options: You have to finish your homework before you leave.
She may go to the dentist tomorrow.
He must to clean his room before going out.
We might to arrive early for the meeting.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses "going to" to express future plans or intentions:
options: He is going to cook dinner yesterday.
We are going to see to the beach
We are going to visit our grandparents next Sunday.
Elizabet is going to the office at the moment

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses the present continuous tense to express future arrangements:
options: They are flying to Paris next week.
She is watching a movie now.
He is cooking dinner at the moment.
We are going to buy you a present.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a phrase to talk about the future:
options: You need to prepare the exam on the spot
This heavy vehicle is out of order
I am about to send you my presentation
She likes to think out of the box

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses the past perfect tense:
options: She had finished her homework before dinner.
They had went to the concert last night.
He has been studying for the exam all day.
We have visited the museum yesterday.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a verb followed by a gerund:
options: She enjoys to read novels in her free time.
They stopped to eat lunch at the café.
We decided going fishing last summer.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a verb followed by an infinitive:
options: She avoids to read books in the late evening.
They forgot bringing their umbrellas on the rainy day.
He needs to finish his homework before going out.
We decided going for a hike in the mountains.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses "in order to":
options: She woke up early in order to catching the train.
They rushed to the store in order to buy groceries.
He went for a run in order to will improve his fitness.
We studied hard in order to so pass the exam.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses the passive voice:
options: A delicious meal was being cooked by the chef in the kitchen.
They have finished the project ahead of schedule.
He will be eating dinner at the restaurant tonight with his friends.
We are studying for the exam tomorrow.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly conveys surprise:
options: She was not expecting to see her friend at the party.
They had planned a surprise birthday party for their mother.
We decided to go on a spontaneous road trip.
He didn't do the task that was given before.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a linker of contrast:
options: She loves both chocolate ice cream and vanilla ice cream.
He enjoys playing soccer as well as basketball.
While he is outgoing, she is shy and reserved.
They went to the beach because it was a sunny day.

questions.question: What were the main goals of the "Guldene ber, tugan el!" campaign in West Kazakhstan?
options: to bring attention to the country’s heritage
to distribute free trees to local residents
questions.group_text:
Tree Day was a nationwide campaign held in cities and towns of Kazakhstan in April and May 2017. During this period people planted about 1 million trees – Canadian maple, white willow, oak, spruce, ash, birch, pine and many others.

The organisers hoped that this initiative would eventually become a real holiday for all citizens of our country, and each resident would plant a tree or, even better, a few trees! “Together we have the opportunity to both preserve and increase the green lungs of Kazakhstan. After all, the role of forests in our lives is impossible to overestimate. They not only have an impact on the life of the individual but also act as a guarantee for the wellbeing of the environment”, the Foundation noted.

In West Kazakhstan there is a large-scale campaign called “Guldene ber, tugan el!”. The main aims of the campaign are to raise awareness of the country’s heritage and ecological education and to improve conditions in the city. In total, 36 thousand inhabitants of the region took part in the campaign, about 8 thousand of whom were young people.

"“Together we have the opportunity to both preserve and increase the green lungs of Kazakhstan"
options: to tell that wildlife in Kazakhstan is poor
to tell the reader that wildlife can be improved
to call Kazakhstan's authority to financially aid
to criticize the wildlife in Kazakhstan

questions.question: What is the main idea of the text?
options: The text outlines Kazakhstan's launch of local projects, including Tree Day and "Guldene ber, tugan el!", to discourage environmental awareness, hinder tree planting, and neglect cultural heritage.

The text highlights Kazakhstan's adoption of nationwide initiatives such as Tree Day and "Guldene ber, tugan el!" to enhance environmental consciousness, stimulate tree cultivation, and uphold cultural heritage.

The text emphasizes Kazakhstan's implementation of international campaigns like Tree Day and "Guldene ber, tugan el!" to foster economic development, deter tree planting, and ignore cultural heritage.
The text discusses Kazakhstan's involvement in regional initiatives such as Tree Day and "Guldene ber, tugan el!" to address political issues, discourage tree planting, and dismiss cultural heritage.
questions.group_text:
Tree Day was a nationwide campaign held in cities and towns of Kazakhstan in April and May 2017. During this period people planted about 1 million trees – Canadian maple, white willow, oak, spruce, ash, birch, pine and many others.

The organisers hoped that this initiative would eventually become a real holiday for all citizens of our country, and each resident would plant a tree or, even better, a few trees! “Together we have the opportunity to both preserve and increase the green lungs of Kazakhstan. After all, the role of forests in our lives is impossible to overestimate. They not only have an impact on the life of the individual but also act as a guarantee for the wellbeing of the environment”, the Foundation noted.

In West Kazakhstan there is a large-scale campaign called “Guldene ber, tugan el!”. The main aims of the campaign are to raise awareness of the country’s heritage and ecological education and to improve conditions in the city. In total, 36 thousand inhabitants of the region took part in the campaign, about 8 thousand of whom were young people.

questions.question: What is the main takeaway regarding the asteroid 2002 NT7?
options: It will definitely collide with Earth in February 2019.
Scientists are confident it will narrowly miss Earth in 2019.
There is uncertainty about its future collision in February 2060.
It has already collided with Earth causing significant damage.
questions.group_text:
Invaders from Outer The Space 

1 Is a huge asteroid going to hit the Earth in February 2019? Probably not, according to scientists, but it’s going to be close. The asteroid, called 2002 NT7, was discovered in July 2002. Since then, astronomers have been working hard to calculate its exact path. They are now fairly con dent that it will just miss the Earth in 2019.

2 But will it ever collide with Earth in the future? Scientists are not sure. The next possible collision date is February 2060 and, as the asteroid orbits the Sun every 2.2 years, it’s quite likely that it will hit us at some point in the future. If it does, it will almost certainly destroy an area the size of Europe and cause global climate changes.

3 But before you start panicking, we’ll have plenty of time to prepare for the collision and prevent it from happening. Unlike in the movies, though, this probably won’t be done by destroying it with nuclear weapons. There will be two simpler options. The rst will involve landing a small rocket on the asteroid and ‘driving’ it slightly o course so it misses the Earth. The second option will be to use a ‘solar sail’, which is a bit like the sail on a ship, to change the asteroid’s course.

4 Meteors (asteroids which enter the Earth’s atmosphere) have hit the Earth before and caused huge damage. Indeed it’s possible that a meteor was responsible for the dinosaurs becoming extinct. These days, however, we have the technology to detect them in time and to take appropriate action. Next time it happens, we’ll be ready for it.

questions.question: What is one proposed method for preventing the asteroid from colliding with Earth?
options: Using nuclear weapons to destroy the asteroid.
Landing a small rocket on the asteroid to alter its course.
Ignoring the asteroid and hoping it changes direction on its own.
Building a shield around Earth to deflect the asteroid's path.

I really need to cut down on sugar
I think you should not take it personally

questions.question: Fruits are
Which verbs are followed by –ing
Find Perfect tense sentence(s)
options: We aim to increase the speed of delivery.
He had finished his homework before the movie started.
She will be happy with her exam results.
By next week, I will have completed all my assignments.
The children were shouting when the teacher came in.
You are not going to finish on time if you keep working slow.

questions.question: Complete the sentences with the correct adjectives/nouns
Choose the right words that suit the context:
options: Every summer, we ___________ to Hawaii to enjoy the beaches and the vibrant culture.
During our picnic, a persistent _______  kept buzzing around our food, making it hard to eat peacefully.

questions.question: Choose the right verbs to complete the sentences:
options: She is ________ a new job next Monday.

questions.question: Choose the right modal verbs
Complete the sentences using the right articles
options: ________ Mississippi River, is often called the backbone of America's waterway system.
Jimmy tries to read a book for at least thirty minutes __________ day to relax before bedtime.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the 'TEENS' project in Kazakhstan?
questions.group_text: The online project ‘TEENS’, recently launched in Kazakhstan, is aimed to help teenagers cope with their problems. The time between 13 and 16 is a period full of changes as we start to become more grown-up. However, the majority of teens often encounter problems such as misunderstandings with parents, teachers or peers, family quarrels or depression. The reasons for these problems are often very different, from being bullied at school to questioning one’s place in life. The founders of the ‘TEENS’ project believe that any problem can be worked out successfully. It becomes easier to do so when a teenager and their family know where to find help. On the project’s website you can find contact details for experienced psychologists and a teenage helpline, do a psychological test, and read useful resources in order to learn more about dealing with problems.

questions.question: Why do 13-16 years old teenagers have problems?
options: They have some as they simply age
They have them because of too much homework
They have them because parents work too much
They have them because they don't want to study

questions.question: Based on the description of the 'TEENS' project, which of the following best reflects the underlying philosophy of the project's approach to addressing teenage problems?
options: Immediate resolution of problems is crucial to prevent long-term psychological effects.
Understanding and addressing teenage problems requires active involvement from both teenagers and their families.
Teenage problems are best managed through strict disciplinary actions.
Teenagers should handle their problems independently to build resilience.
